ygData.subject: Re: Guise of the Deceiver
ygData.msgSnippet: Finally, somebody mentioned it.  I chose a 1/2-elf, and live with wearing only med armor, not getting hide or forage at 50 skill  to start, not getting bash,
ygData.messageBody:
Finally, somebody mentioned it. I chose a 1/2-elf, and live with wearing
only med armor, not getting hide or forage at 50 skill to start, not
getting bash, not having a str at over 100 at lvl one, not having
ultravision, not being able to enter Neriak or Oggok or Ferrott, and not
being obnoxoiusly big...

it was my choice... and I am way pro-choice. Ohhh, that prolly isn't
approriate for this list. hehehe... :)

Kerouac Dharmabum
27 Rod Nife
----- Original Message -----
From: <kim@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Thursday, December 09, 1999 2:05 PM
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Guise of the Deceiver


> From: <kim@...>
>
> On Thu, 9 Dec 1999, Cranfill, Wendy wrote:
>
> > Ok, I play a Barbarian Shaman as well and I have a guise.
> > And I have to say here that I don't think it's unfair that other races
can
> > equip it. Have you ever tried to zone from Guk or Sol B when there is a
> > Troll, Ogre or Barbarian in your way? As a Shaman, I can shrink, but
for
> > the others, being small was of HUGE importance in a dungeon... not to
> > mention the ultravision benefit. Anyway, I'm fine with the change, but
> > don't think it was necessary.
>
> Having difficulty maneuvering in dungeons, and not having
> ultravision were supposed to be disadvantages of playing
> certain races.
>
> --
> John H. Kim
> kim@...
>
> > Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to lol@...
with the subject submissions.
>
